DataElement.preferredName: Age First Dementia EMR Qualifying Event Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The first time the loss of intellectual abilities interfering with an individual's social and occupational functions qualified by their Electronic Medical Records.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Age First Dementia EMR Qualifying Event
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The first time the loss of intellectual abilities interfering with an individual's social and occupational functions qualified by their Electronic Medical Records.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A period or stage in life, usually stated in years since birth.

Concepts.definition: How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.

Property.preferredName: First Dementia Electronic Medical Record Qualifying Event
Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:An acquired organic mental disorder with loss of intellectual abilities of sufficient severity to interfere with social or occupational functioning. The dysfunction is multifaceted and involves memory, behavior, personality, judgment, attention, spatial relations, language, abstract thought, and other executive functions. The intellectual decline is usually progressive, and initially spares the level of consciousness.:An automated, on-line medical record containing clinical and demographic information about a patient that is available to providers, ancillary service departments, pharmacies, and others involved in patient treatment or care.:Success in satisfying a test or requirement.:Event; something that happens at a given place and time.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Loss of intellectual abilities interfering with an individual's social and occupational functions. Causes include Alzheimer's disease, brain injuries, brain tumors, and vascular disorders.

An automated, on-line medical record containing clinical and demographic information about a patient that is available to providers, ancillary service departments, pharmacies, and others involved in patient treatment or care.
Success in satisfying a test or requirement.
Something that happens at a given place and time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
